items.message:
River levels have risen at the Castle Farm river gauge overnight as a result of Friday's heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected this morning.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Blythe between Cheswick Green and Blyth End.  We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated this evening, 27/06/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
River levels are expected to be high as a result of spring tides.

The forecast high tide at Richmond will be 4.64mAOD at 17:45 on 27/06/21 and 4.70mAOD at 06:15 on 28/06/21.

Flooding of low-lying roads and footpaths is expected, which may exist for one to two hours either side of high tide. Flooding of properties is not expected.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. 

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is low for this time of year at 30 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain low for the next few days.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

This message will be updated by 11:00 on 28/06/21, or as the situation changes.

Please note spring tides continue through the weekend but they are not currently forecast to get to Tidal Flood Alert level. 
We continue to monitor tides and tide levels through this period.

items.description: River Stour and Smestow Brook in the Black Country and South Staffordshire
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood alert risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further light rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively monitoring river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please stay aware in case further warnings are issued.

floodArea.county: Birmingham, Dudley, Sandwell, Solihull, Walsall, Warwickshire, Wolverhampton

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels have fallen slightly on the River Kennet but are currently generally stable and should begin to fall again soon. Therefore, the risk of flooding is reducing. 
Isolated heavy rain and thundery showers are forecast for the weekend. We expect river levels to begin falling again this afternoon 26/06/2021.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are in the area checking defences. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow 27/06/2021, or as the situation changes.
